climbs.name: Mom There's Pink in my Burger

content.description: If you are looking for a good first lead, or a very moderate warm up, this is your route. One of the most popular, if not the most in the area.
content.location: Right side of Write-off Rock. The feature this climbs protrudes from the main formation slightly. It's currently the second route from the left.

climbs.name: Legacy Bolt
climbs.fa: Mack Johnson and Clayton Baber, November 2019

content.description:
The interesting feature of this route is the gigantic 1-1/2" thick piece of iron installed during the railroad construction.  It is on a small shelf and hard to see from the base.

Ascend the slab past a tricky crux at the second bolt, sling the "legacy bolt", then finish past horizontals and the top bulge.  The rock at the top is somewhat shattered.  There are 3 bolts linked by chains with steel lowering biners for top anchors.
content.protection: 4 protection bolts, 60 cm runner for the giant railroad bolt. Small cams may be used in the 3 horizontal cracks.
content.location: On the left side of Write-Off Rock, between Flammable Pajamas and Knife in the Toaster.

content.description: A short route with a crux at the very end. A few standard Write-off moves to the low-angle area with the giant bolt, then steeper climbing with smooth feet to a horizontal crack. Trust those edges and grab something over the top to clip the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts. The two-bolt anchor has chains - one set of chains with a steel lowering carabiner on each one, and an extra set of chains for using your own gear. Neither are really equalized though, both are fairly uneven, so it's hard to see what the point is.
content.location: In the center of Write-off Rock, to the left of the brown streak.

content.description: Short and easy. Low-angle slab with decent texture and big edges.
content.protection: Two bolts, then bolted permadraw anchor.
content.location: On the far left side of Write-Off Rock, climb up the slab.

content.description: Decent route between "Knife in the Toaster" and "Mom There's Pink in My Burger". Solid holds and good clipping stances makes it a good first lead. Mini-crux getting past the second bolt.
content.protection: Six bolts to a two-bolt anchor with rappel rings.
content.location: Located between "Knife in the Toaster" and "Mom There's Pink in My Burger". The line of bolts to the right of the brown streak.

content.description: Short. Follows a right-facing ledge up to a five-foot cracked slab before the anchors. Good for soloing or anchor-building/belay practice.
content.protection: Bolted anchor with lowering biners and rap chains.
content.location: Far left of the wall, just right of the small tree. Anchors are visible from a bit right of the start.

content.description: A nice climb in a good location for beginners. Small roof move with many options is the crux, soon after you get off the ground. Well protected and fun.
content.protection: There are 5 bolts with chains on the anchors at the top.
content.location: This is the route on the right side of Write Off Rock. Just to the left of the tree-filled 'gully,' and to the right of the blocky protrusion that is Mom There's Pink in My Burger.
